qas.question: When was the term Kievan Rus first coined?
When did the term Kievan Rus first appear in English?
Who first translated the term Kievan Rus into english from russian?
What was invented in the 19th century?
When did the term Kievan Rus first appear in Russia?
Who first wrote the term Kievan Rus into english from russian?
What type of cities were also known as Rus?

context: The term "<b3_0>Kievan Rus<b3_0/>'" (Ки́евская Русь Kievskaya Rus’) was coined in the <a0_0>19th century<a0_0/> in Russian historiography to refer to the period when the centre was in Kiev. In English, the term was introduced in the early 20th century, when it was found in the <a1_0><b4_0>1913<b4_0/><a1_0/> English translation of <a2_0><b5_0>Vasily Klyuchevsky<b5_0/><a2_0/>'s A History of Russia, to distinguish the early polity from <b6_0>successor states<b6_0/>, which were also named Rus. Later, the Russian term was rendered into Belarusian and Ukrainian as Кіеўская Русь Kijeŭskaja Rus’ and Ки́ївська Русь Kyivs'ka Rus’, respectively.
